turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: How did it go?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: There was one bad moment -- some hunters stopped us.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: We'd better get started. If the mounted police pick up our trail, they'll come this far at least.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Right.  Let's put the water and provisions in the wagon.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Got your sensors?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Yo!

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Geiger counter?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Yo!

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: One pistol... twenty-four rounds of ammo. two medical kits.. one camera... one TX9.  We've enough food and water for three days.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: But how long is a day?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Good question.  Landon -- check your communications kit.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Nothing will grow here .... there's just a trace of hydrocarbons, and most of the nitrogen is locked into nitrates.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Any sign of dangerous ionization?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Okay. If there's no life here, we've got just seventy-two hours to find it. That's when the groceries run out.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Which direction?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: That way.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Any particular reason?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: None at all.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Taylor -- quit riding him.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: You're more than three hundred light years from your precious planet. Your loved ones have been dead and forgotten for twenty centuries. Even if you could get back, they'd think you were something that fell out of a tree.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Where there's one there's another. And another. And another.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Let's find them all.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Well, at least they haven't tried to bite us.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Blessed are the vegetarians.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Which one was wearing the strange clothes?

turns.speaker: GALEN
turns.text: Him.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Will he live?

turns.speaker: GALEN
turns.text: I don't know. This beast lost a lot of blood.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: This place is dirty, doctor.

turns.speaker: GALEN
turns.text: These animals are dirty, doctor. They stink, and they carry communicable diseases. Why aren't they cleaned up before they're brought here?

turns.speaker: GALEN
turns.text: But the quota system's been abolished! You made it. Why can't I?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: What do you mean, made it? I'm an animal psychologist, that's all. We don't have any authority.

turns.speaker: GALEN
turns.text: You do pretty well when it comes to getting space and equipment.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: That's because Dr. Zaius realizes our work has value.

turns.speaker: GALEN
turns.text: Hmph.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: The foundations of scientific brain surgery are being laid right here - in studies of cerebral function in these animals.

turns.speaker: GALEN
turns.text: They're still dirty. And their bite is septic. Look at that ...

turns.speaker: HONORIUS
turns.text: Objection. The accused is indeed a man. Therefore, he has no rights under ape law.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Well, Dr. Zira? This is a man, is he not?

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: State your case, Mr. Prosecutor.

turns.speaker: HONORIUS
turns.text: Learned Judges: My case is simple. It is based on our first Article of Faith: that the Almighty created the ape in his own image; that He gave him a soul and a mind; that He set him apart from the beasts of the jungle, and made him the lord of the planet.

turns.speaker: HONORIUS
turns.text: There is a conspiracy afoot to undermine the very cornerstone of our Faith

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Come to the point, Dr. Honorius.

turns.speaker: HONORIUS
turns.text: Directly, Mr. President. This wretched man, the accused, is only a pawn in the conspiracy. We know that he was wounded in the throat at the time of his capture. The State charges that Dr. Zira and a corrupt surgeon named Galen experimented on this wounded animal, tampering with his brain and throat tissues to create a speaking monster ...

turns.speaker: HONORIUS
turns.text: He can reason? With the Tribunal's permission, let me expose this hoax by direct examination.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Proceed. But don't turn this hearing into a farce.

turns.speaker: HONORIUS
turns.text: That's true, Dr. Zaius. My witnesses -- correction -- my exhibits are on display in the amphitheater.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Very well. I suggest we go and look at them.

turns.speaker: HONORIUS
turns.text: Objection! These remarks are profane and irrelevant.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Sustained.  Your archeological theories have no bearing on the disposition of this creature.

turns.speaker: HONORIUS
turns.text: Objection!

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Sustained.

turns.speaker: HONORIUS
turns.text: Yes, sir. The State charges Doctors Zira and Cornelius with contempt of this Tribunal, malicious mischief and scientific heresy.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Be it so ordered. The Tribunal will examine all the evidence presented here and in due time render a verdict on the proposed indictment and on the disposition of the deviate in question.  This hearing is adjourned.

turns.speaker: HONORIUS
turns.text: Tell the court, Bright Eyes -- what is the second Article of Faith?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I admit, I know nothing of your culture.

turns.speaker: HONORIUS
turns.text: Of course he doesn't know our culture - because he cannot think.  Tell us why all apes are created equal.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Some apes, it seems, are more equal than others.

turns.speaker: HONORIUS
turns.text: Ridiculous. That answer is a contradiction in terms. Tell us, Bright Eyes, why do men have no souls? What is the proof that a divine spark exists in the simian brain?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Show this to the President.

turns.speaker: JULIUS
turns.text: Good morning, Dr. Zira.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Good morning, Julius. How's our patient today?

turns.speaker: JULIUS
turns.text: No change. The minute you open the door, he goes into his act.

turns.speaker: JULIUS
turns.text: You could get hurt doing that, Doctor.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Don't be silly. He's perfectly tame.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Awww, it still hurts, doesn't it?

turns.speaker: JULIUS
turns.text: See? He keeps pretending he can talk.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Did you see that? It's remarkable!

turns.speaker: JULIUS
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: He's trying to form words.

turns.speaker: JULIUS
turns.text: Well, you know what they say. Human see, human do.

turns.speaker: JULIUS
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Those fools and their torches! Do you have any ointment?

turns.speaker: JULIUS
turns.text: I'll see.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Get me a collar and leash. I'm taking him to the infirmary.

turns.speaker: JULIUS
turns.text: He's vicious, Doctor. Besides, it's against the rules.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Do as I say.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Landon! Send a last signal.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: What signal?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: To Earth! That we've landed!

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: It's no use ... there she goes.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Forget it. Abandon ship.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Gone.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: We're here to stay.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Well? Where are we? Have any notion, skipper?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: We're some three hundred and twenty light years from Earth. On an unnamed planet in orbit around a star in the constellation of Orion.  That could be Bellatrix.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Landon! Join the expedition.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Sorry...  I was thinking of Stewart. What d'you suppose happened?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Air leak. Died in her sleep.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: You don't seem very cut up about it.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: It's a little late for a wake. She's been dead nearly a year.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Then we've been away from Earth for eighteen months.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: By our time.  You've turned gray.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Apart from that, you look pretty chipper for a man who's two thousand and thirty one years old.  I read the clocks. They bear out Hasslein's hypothesis. We've been away from Earth for two thousand years, give or take a decade.  Still can't accept it, huh?

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: long pause) You know it.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Because time has wiped out everyone and everything you cared for -- they're dust.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Prove it. If we can't get back, it's still just a theory.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: It's a fact, Landon. Buy it. You'll sleep better.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: If only we could get a fix.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: What would you learn? I've told you where you are and when you are.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: All right --

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: There's only one reality left. We're here and it's now. You get ahold of that and hang on tight, or you might as well be dead.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I'm prepared to die.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Straighten me out on something. Why did you come along at all? You volunteered. Why?  I'll tell you. They nominated you for the Big One and you couldn't turn it down. Not without losing your All-American standing

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Climb off me, will you!

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: And the glory, don't forget that. There's a life-sized bronze statue of you somewhere. It's probably turned green by now, and nobody can read the name plate. But never let it be said we forget our heroes.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Taylor.	I'm telling you --

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Oh, and one last item. Immortality. You wanted to go on forever.  Well, you damn near made it. Except for Dodge and me, you've lived longer than anybody. And with Stewart dead, it looks like we're the last of the strain. You got what you wanted, kid. How does it taste?

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Okay. You read me well enough. Why can't I read you?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Don't bother

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Dodge ... he's not like me at all. But he makes sense. Held walk naked into a live volcano if he thought he could learn something no other man knew. I understand why  he's here. But you...You're no seeker. You're negative.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: But I'm not prepared to die.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: I'd like to know why not. You thought life on Earth was meaningless. You despised people. So what did you do? You ran away.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Scarecrows?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Let's take a look.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Can we take a dip?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: No cigar.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: Try telling them our names.

turns.speaker: LANDON
turns.text: We got off at the wrong stop.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: You're our optimist Look at the bright side. If that's the best there is around here, in six months we'll be running this planet.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: LUCIUS
turns.text: So you can talk.  I'm Dr. Zira's nephew. This abduction was her idea. You're not really going to the zoo. That's just our cover story in case we're stopped.  Although I do feel that if it ever came down to a question of whether something like you should be public or private property --

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Come on. Get me out of here.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: She comes along too.

turns.speaker: LUCIUS
turns.text: Zira doesn't want your female.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I want her.

turns.speaker: LUCIUS
turns.text: If you insist. But I'm not taking any orders --

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Fine. Just let her out.

turns.speaker: LUCIUS
turns.text: Shouldn't we be moving on?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I'm for that.

turns.speaker: LUCIUS
turns.text: Why did you do that? Scrape off your hair?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: In my world -- before I left it - only youngsters of your age wore un- scraped hair.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Sorry, Lucius. You'll have to stay here and guard the horses.

turns.speaker: LUCIUS
turns.text: Always giving orders. Just like every other adult.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Relax. You'll see it all later.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Not everything. They left a hostage.  How do you feel, Lucius?

turns.speaker: LUCIUS
turns.text: Disillusioned...  But vindicated! I've been right all along. You can't trust the older generation. It's a matter of values --

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: All right, all right. Will You do me a favor? No orders.

turns.speaker: LUCIUS
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I want you to go around the bend and tell those gorillas their leader is my prisoner.

turns.speaker: LUCIUS
turns.text: Yes, I can do that.

turns.speaker: LUCIUS
turns.text: They think you're behaving foolishly. I must say I agree. Where will you go?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I'll start by following the shoreline.  And my nose.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Lucius.

turns.speaker: LUCIUS
turns.text: I think you're making a mistake.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: That's the boy. Keep 'em flying.

turns.speaker: LUCIUS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: The flags of discontent. It's the only way anything ever gets changed.  Don't try to follow us.  I'm pretty handy with things like this.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: I told you not to bring the other one.

turns.speaker: LUCIUS
turns.text: He wouldn't leave her.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: All right...  Get in...hurry.  Put this on.

turns.speaker: LUCIUS
turns.text: Gorilla hunters ...

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Keep moving. We can't turn back now.

turns.speaker: LUCIUS
turns.text: Who put them up?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: The Hunt Club.

turns.speaker: LUCIUS
turns.text: To scare off humans?

turns.speaker: MAXIMUS
turns.text: What is that?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: A man, Dr. Maximus.

turns.speaker: MAXIMUS
turns.text: I know it's a man. And you know the rules. No animals outside the compound, and most certainly not without a leash.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Yes, Sir. But this -- creature is a special case.

turns.speaker: MAXIMUS
turns.text: Why special?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: We're -- conducting a new experiment.

turns.speaker: MAXIMUS
turns.text: You asked for the opportunity to present your case. Surely you must know why you're here.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: My own purpose is to save this exceptional creature from mutilation.

turns.speaker: MAXIMUS
turns.text: And our purpose is to settle custodial and jurisdictional questions concerning this beast, and determine what's to be done with him.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: At the very least, this man has the right to know whether there's a charge against him.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Dr. Zira -- tell Bright Eyes to sit down.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: My name is Taylor.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: It says here that his name is Bright Eyes. You gave him that name yourself.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: This hearing is absurd! Let me tell my story...

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Bailiff! Make the animal be quiet.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: One is in a museum!

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Dr. Zira! Silence that man!

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: You destroyed his memory! His mind! His identity! And, you want to do the same to me!

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Bailiff! Stop this outburst! Gag that monstrosity!

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Let it be clear at the outset that all matters pertaining to this inquiry are confidential, and anyone discussing them outside this chamber will be held in contempt of the Tribunal.  You may proceed, Dr. Honorius.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: By your leave, Mr. President -- the Tribunal has not yet defined the purpose of this inquiry.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Sustained. In all fairness, Dr. Zira, you must admit the accused is a nonape, and therefore has no rights under ape law.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Then why is he called the accused Your Honors must think him guilty of something.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: That√ïs a lie!

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Mind your tongue, madame.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Did we create his mind too? Not only can this man speak. He can write. He can reason.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Since the defendant is forbidden to speak in his own defense, he asks that this statement be read into the record.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Read it yourself.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: 'I have come to you from a planet in a different solar system. I am an explorer in space, with no hostile intentions against your civilization. On my planet it was the primate Man who evolved Into a thinking animal, while the apes remained..."

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Stop right there. Bring me that paper.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: This is a joke in very poor taste.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Is it a joke to seek the truth about this man?

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: How so?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Let us assume, as common sense dictates, that the prisoner's story is false. But if he does not come from another planet, then surely he sprang from our own. Yes, sprang.  As an animal psychologist, I have found no physiological defect to explain why humans are mute.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Sustained.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Sustain all objections, but face the truth!

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Well...do you acknowledge kinship with any of these creatures?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: With one of them.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Identify him, then. Speak to him.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: What about me?

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Oh, your case was preordained. In a way, you performed a service for the State ...  Because your hearing made it possible for us to expose Zira and Cornelius.  And now the Tribunal has placed you in my custody for...final disposition. Do you know what that means?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Emasculation, to begin with. Then experimental surgery. On the speech centers. On the brain. Ultimately, a kind of living death.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: However, it's within my power to grant You a reprieve.  That is why I summoned you here tonight.  Tell me who and what you really are and where you come from, and no veterinary will touch you.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I told the truth at that 'hearing'of yours.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: You lied. Where is your tribe?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: My tribe, as you call it, lives on another planet in a distant solar system.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Then how is it we speak the same language?  Even in your lies, some truth slips through! That mythical community you're supposed to come from -- Fort Wayne'?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: What about it?

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: A fort! Unconsciously, you chose a name that was belligerent.  Where were you nurtured?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I take it you don't believe the prosecutor's charge -- that I'm a monster created by Dr. Zira.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Certainly not.	You're a mutant.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: That's exactly what Zira and Cornelius claim. You're talking heresy, doctor.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: All right, suppose I am a mutant? Why does the appearance of one mutant send you into a panic?

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Because you're not unique. There was the one you call Landon --

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Then you admit --

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: I admit that where there's one mutant there's probably another. And another. A nest of them. Where's your nest, Taylor? Where are your women?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Thank you for calling me Taylor.  Dr. Zaius, I know who I am. Who are you? How did this upside down civilization ever get started?

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: You may well call it upside down, since you occupy its lowest level. And deservedly.  The eastern desert has never been explored -- because we've always assumed that no life can exist there.  Save yourself, Taylor. Tell me -- is there another jungle beyond the Forbidden Zone?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: If you are protecting others of your kind, it will cost you your identity.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I'm not protecting anybody! That hearing was a farce. What have I done?

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: You're a menace! A walking pestilence. I do know who you are, Taylor. As I know that others of your kind must live in the Forbidden Zone.  You have just six hours to make a full confession. After that I'll employ surgery to obtain one.  Guards!

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Stop right there.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Don't be a fool. You're outnumbered and outgunned.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: There is no contradiction between faith and science. True science.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: All right, let's see if you're willing to put that statement to a test.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: What is your proposal?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: When were the Sacred Scrolls written?

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Twelve hundred years ago.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Very well. If Zira and Cornelius can prove that those scrolls don't tell the whole truth of your history; if they can show you definite evidence of another culture from an unrecorded past -- will you exonerate them?

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Okay.Up to the cave.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I don't say he was a man like an Earthman, but I'd call him a close relative, for he was plagued by most of man's ills.  Yet, fragile as he was, he came before you -- and was superior to you.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: That's lunacy. I can give an alternate description for everyone of those objects that's equally as inventive as yours. But it would be conjecture, not proof.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Tell him to pull back!

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Cease fire! Withdraw!

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Then answer this: If ran was superior, why didn't he survive?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: He might have been wiped out by a plague. Natural catastrophe. Like a fiery storm of meteors. From the looks of this part of your planet, I'd say that was a fair bet.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Then there is another jungle?

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Of course, you could return with us. Our society might find a place for you and your mate.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Sure.	In a cage.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Where else, but in a cage, does man belong?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: No, thanks. I'll take freedom.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Why? From the first, I've terrified you, Doctor. And in spite of every sign that I'm an intelligent being who means no harm, you continue to hate and fear me. Why?

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Because you are a man. And you were right -- I have always known about man. From the evidence, I believe his wisdom must walk hand in hand with his idiocy. His emotions must rule his brain. He must be a warlike animal who gives battle to everything around him -- even himself.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: What evidence? No weapons were found in the cave.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: The Forbidden Zone was once a paradise. Your breed made a desert of it, ages ago.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: We're back at the beginning. I still don't know the why. A planet where apes evolved from men. A world turned wrong side up. A puzzle with one piece missing.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Don't look for it, Taylor. You may not like what you find.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Well, Bright Eyes, is our throat feeling better?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Listen, listen -- I can speak --

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Speak! Go on.	Speak again.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: My - name - isn't - Bright Eyes It's Taylor!

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: There! Can you believe it? I looks like he's talking.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I'm not acting! I can talk! How much proof do you want?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Dr. Zaius, I could have sworn he was answering you!

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Where have you been? Why didn't you come to see me?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Shhhh!

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: What is this?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: A hearing.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: It's him...Landon.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Which one?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Second from the left.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: You! ... You knew about this?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: No, I swear -- I never saw this man before.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: You did this to him! You've removed his frontal lobes!

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Listen-

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Taylor -- just keep quiet and we may get away with this. Remember that men all look alike to most apes.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Cornelius and I have been indicted for heresy. Unless we can prove our theories, we don't stand a chance of acquittal.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: You're going back to the Forbidden Zone?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Are you going to take her with you?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Actually, you're a different breed. This creature will never evolve.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Maybe not.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: You want her that much?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: You threw us together, remember? And you guessed right. Men, like apes, get despondent without a mate.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: What's the diagnosis, doctor? A touch of the sun?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: She's not sick at all.  She's pregnant.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: And that's your Minister of Science. Honor- bound to expand the frontiers of knowledge.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Taylor, please --

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Except that he's also the Chief Defender of the Faith.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Taylor! Tell him.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: He has a point. On my planet children often play with ape dolls.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Then tell them Dr. Zaius won't leave here alive.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Taylor, you can't.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Taylor, please -- don't treat him that way.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: It's humiliating.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Wasn't I humiliated? By all of you? Didn't you lead me around on a leash?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Would you like to come along?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: We can't.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: It's better than going to prison for heresy.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Dr. Zira, I'd like to kiss you good-bye.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: All right, but....  ...you're so damned ugly!

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Go with God, Taylor.  That's an old expression. it comes from both ape and man.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: God bless you.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: He's moving his fingers!

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Of course. He saw you moving yours.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: But perhaps he understood --

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Wouldn't it more properly be done in your office?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Yes, Sir.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Dr. Zira -- you state here that a ship from outer space sank in an inland sea of our eastern desert.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: I do not state it, sir. The prisoner does.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Do you believe him?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Like you, I find it difficult.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: But how convenient that the proof of his arrival has vanished?  You also state that Bright Eyes had two intelligent companions at the time of his capture.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: This is his assertion.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Where are they now?

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: How sad. Stuffed and mounted, eh? Dead men, like sunken ships, can tell no stories. And his other companion?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: He doesn't know.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Mr. President, I believe the Prosecutor has reassembled all he surviving humans captured in the hunt along with Bright Eyes.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Let them talk, Mr President. Let them talk.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Sirs: our theories have a bearing on his identity.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Secondly, if these 'tools' as you call them, are unidentified, why are they introduced as 'evidence' of anything?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: But there's the doll, sir.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: What?
